title: Indigo Block-Print Shawl
description: Hand-loomed cotton shawl with traditional Gujarati block-print motifs. Natural indigo dye fades beautifully over time, developing a unique patina. Lightweight enough for layering, substantial enough to anchor an outfit. Each piece varies slightly due to the handcraft process.
careInstructions: Hand wash cold separately. Line dry in shade. Iron on medium heat if needed.

Indigo block-print shawl laid flat showing full pattern
Close-up detail of block-print pattern and hand-rolled edge

title: Reversible Linen Jacket
description: Tailored jacket with invisible seams—wear it indigo or olive. Cut with dropped shoulders and a relaxed fit that works over everything from tees to kurtas. Hand-stitched lapel and pockets. This piece takes 10 days to make because every seam is finished twice.
careInstructions: Dry clean or hand wash cold. Reshape while damp and line dry. Wrinkles are part of linen's character.

images.alt: Model wearing reversible linen jacket in indigo side
Model wearing reversible linen jacket in olive side
Detail of invisible seam construction and coconut button

title: Wide-Leg Cotton Trousers
description: High-waisted trousers with a palazzo silhouette. Hand-loomed cotton from a family mill in Tamil Nadu. Deep pockets (actually usable), covered elastic waist, slightly cropped to show your shoes. Available in standard sizes or made-to-measure for your exact inseam and rise.
careInstructions: Machine wash cold on gentle. Tumble dry low or line dry. May shrink slightly—we account for this in sizing.

Wide-leg cotton trousers laid flat showing silhouette
Close-up of deep pocket and elastic waistband detail

title: Marigold Silk Wrap Shawl
description: Raw silk shawl dyed with marigold flowers—the same calendula Rani grew in her courtyard. Long enough to wrap twice or drape asymmetrically. Edges are hand-fringed. The color shifts depending on light: burnt orange in sun, deep amber indoors. Limited run of 12 pieces.
careInstructions: Dry clean only. Store away from direct sunlight to preserve color.

images.alt: Model wearing marigold silk wrap shawl in natural sunlight
Marigold silk shawl laid flat showing hand-fringed edges
Detail of silk texture and natural dye variation

title: Quilted Wool Jacket
description: Structured jacket with traditional kantha quilting—tiny running stitches that take 40 hours per garment. Made from organic wool with cotton lining. Stand collar, snap closures hidden under a placket, two chest pockets. Fits close through shoulders, relaxed through body. A winter piece you'll keep for decades.
material: Organic wool outer, cotton voile lining, kantha hand-quilting
careInstructions: Dry clean only. Store with cedar or lavender to prevent moths.

images.alt: Model wearing quilted wool jacket with stand collar
Close-up of kantha quilting stitches and texture
Detail of hidden snap closures and chest pocket

title: Embroidered Linen Trousers
description: Straight-leg trousers with hand-embroidered cuffs—a nod to traditional pajama detailing. Made from stone-washed linen that's soft from the first wear. Adjustable drawstring waist, side seam pockets, wide enough to move but tailored enough to tuck in a shirt. The embroidery motif varies slightly; we can send photos of current stock.
careInstructions: Machine wash cold. Hang dry or tumble dry low. Press embroidered areas on reverse side.
